class mas_navigation.custom_environment.Agent(Kp=10, Ki=0, Kd=0)[source]¶

Mobile agent with A* guidance, Q-learning state, and simple PID tracking.

Last assigned scalar reward.

Type:

float

Parameters:

  • Kp (float) – Proportional gain for both PID controllers.

  • Ki (float) – Integral gain for both PID controllers.

  • Kd (float) – Derivative gain for both PID controllers.

class mas_navigation.custom_environment.Landmark[source]¶

Bases: Landmark

Goal landmark.

The landmark is non‑movable and used to check goal proximity.

is_collision(agent)[source]¶

Return True if the agent overlaps the landmark.

Uses Euclidean distance and the agent radius.

Parameters:

agent (Agent) – Agent instance.

Returns:

True if the agent is within its radius of the landmark center.

Return type:

bool

class mas_navigation.custom_environment.RandomLandmark[source]¶

Bases: Landmark

Rectangular landmark that can be used as a random obstacle in training. Currently not used in the environment.

The rectangle is represented by center position and width × height in meters.

reset_world(world, np_random)[source]¶

Randomize agent states and goal points.

Ensures no overlap with obstacles, enforces inter‑agent spacing, and avoids goal conflicts.

Parameters:

  • world (World) – World to modify.

  • np_random (np.random.Generator) – Random generator from PettingZoo.

reward(agent, world)[source]¶

Compute shaped reward for a single agent.

Penalizes collisions and out-of-bounds, adds small time penalty, and rewards A*-aligned actions.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – Agent instance.

  • world (World) – World instance.

Returns:

Scalar reward for this agent and step.

Return type:

float

Bases: World

World with custom continuous dynamics and collision handling for mixed shapes.

apply_action_force(p_force)[source]¶

Map agent actions to planar forces.

The first two entries of the action vector are interpreted as desired planar velocities. A global scale is applied when converting to forces.

Parameters:

p_force (list[np.ndarray | None]) – Force accumulator.

Returns:

Updated force accumulator.

Return type:

list[np.ndarray | None]

apply_environment_force(p_force)[source]¶

Apply environment forces such as contacts. Currently a no-op.

Stub that returns the input unchanged.

Parameters:

p_force (list[np.ndarray | None]) – Force accumulator.

Returns:

Unchanged force accumulator.

Return type:

list[np.ndarray | None]

get_collision_force(entity_a, entity_b)[source]¶

Compute contact forces and termination flags between two entities.

Handles three cases: rectangle–rectangle, rectangle–disk, and disk–disk. Uses a soft penetration model with contact margin and sets termination flags on agents upon significant penetration.

Parameters:

  • entity_a – First entity.

  • entity_b – Second entity.

Returns:

Force on A and force on B.

Return type:

list[np.ndarray | None, np.ndarray | None]

integrate_state(p_force)[source]¶

Integrate positions using applied forces and reset velocities.

Parameters:

p_force (list[np.ndarray | None]) – Per-entity force vectors in world coordinates.

mas_navigation.custom_environment.print_state(state)[source]¶

Print the compact Q-state representation.

The layout shows a 3x3 center region and four aggregated directional regions in the order top, left, right, bottom. The center cell represents the A* action direction.

Parameters:

state (Sequence[int]) – Encoded state. First 9 entries are the center 3×3 region. Entries 9..12 encode the four aggregated regions.

class mas_navigation.custom_environment.raw_env(num_good=3, num_obstacles=4, max_cycles=100, continuous_actions=True, render_mode=None)[source]¶

Bases: SimpleEnv, EzPickle

PettingZoo MPE environment with A*, local state encoding, and tabular Q-Learning.

A_star(start_node, end_node)[source]¶

Compute a shortest path on the discrete grid.

Uses best‑first search with total cost g + h (A*) and reconstructs the path by following parent pointers.

Parameters:

  • start_node (Node) – Start node.

  • end_node (Node) – Goal node.

Returns:

Path as a list of (x, y) positions

in world coordinates. None if no path exists.

Return type:

list[tuple[float, float]] | None

a_star_direction(agent, a_star_new)[source]¶

Return the dominant discrete direction toward the next target.

Chooses either the goal or the nearest remaining A* waypoint and returns as a discrete action code.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – Agent instance.

  • a_star_new (list[tuple[float, float]]) – Remaining A* waypoints.

Returns:

Discrete action code in {0 up, 1 down, 2 left, 3 right}.

Return type:

int

classify_region(grid_region, direction)[source]¶

Classify a 3x4 region into free, passable, or impassable.

Free if the number of obstacle cells is below a threshold. Passable if at least one row or column in the movement direction is fully free. Otherwise impassable.

Parameters:

  • grid_region (list[list[int]]) – 3x4 binary subgrid.

  • direction (str) – One of “top”, “bottom”, “left”, “right”.

Returns:

0 for free, 1 for passable, 2 for impassable.

Return type:

int

Raises:

ValueError – If direction is not recognized.

discrete(agent_pos_x, agent_pos_y, goal_pos_x, goal_pos_y)[source]¶

Discretize free space into a 4‑connected grid and find nearest nodes.

Builds a uniform grid, removes cells inside obstacles, connects 4‑neighborhood, and returns the closest start and goal nodes.

Parameters:

  • agent_pos_x (float) – Agent x.

  • agent_pos_y (float) – Agent y.

  • goal_pos_x (float) – Goal x.

  • goal_pos_y (float) – Goal y.

Returns:

Start and end nodes on the free grid.

Return type:

tuple[Node | None, Node | None]

draw()[source]¶

Render entities, goals, and local grid overlay with pygame.

Assumes an initialized pygame screen and viewport. Draws agents as disks, goals as rings, obstacles as rectangles, and the local grid around each agent.

Raises:

AssertionError – If screen coordinates compute out of bounds.

get_cont_action(observation, dimension, discrete_action, agent)[source]¶

Convert a discrete move into a continuous control vector.

Sets PID setpoints one grid cell away, computes planar velocity commands, and maps them into the MPE action vector layout.

Parameters:

  • observation (np.ndarray) – Current observation [x, y, goal_x, goal_y].

  • dimension (int) – World dimension, expected 2.

  • discrete_action (int) – Discrete action in {0,1,2,3}.

  • agent (str) – Agent name.

Returns:

Continuous action vector of length 2*dimension + 1.

Return type:

np.ndarray

  • agent_y (float) – Current y.

Returns:

  • y (float) – World y coordinate.

  • current_agent (Agent) – Agent to exclude from the check.

Return type:

bool

is_obstacle(x, y, q_learning=False, override_epsilon=None)[source]¶

Return True if (x, y) lies inside an obstacle region.

Semantics

Planning / state encoding (q_learning=True)

Rectangular and random rectangular landmarks are treated as obstacles using the planning margin (epsilon_planning). The outer boundary is not checked here because A* paths do not intersect walls.

Runtime (q_learning=False)

Only rectangular landmarks are treated as obstacles using the runtime margin (epsilon_runtime). Out-of-bounds is handled by Scenario.is_out_of_bounds() and not here.

The active epsilon can be overridden via override_epsilon.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – World x coordinate.

  • y (float) – World y coordinate.

  • q_learning (bool, optional) – If True, use planning semantics and margin; if False, use runtime semantics and margin.

  • override_epsilon (float or None, optional) – Margin that replaces the default.

Returns:

True if the point is inside an obstacle region under the selected semantics.

Return type:

bool

last(observe: bool = True) → tuple[ObsType | None, float, bool, bool, dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Return PettingZoo‑style observation tuple for the current agent.

Also updates the agent’s Q‑state before returning.

Parameters:

observe (bool) – If True, compute the observation.

Returns:

(observation, reward, terminated, truncated, info, q_state)

Return type:

tuple

next_agent()[source]¶

Advance the internal agent selector to the next agent.

q_learning_state_space(agent, a_star_new)[source]¶

Encode the local observation for tabular Q‑learning.

Builds a binary occupancy grid around the agent, embeds the A* direction into the center cell, keeps the center 3×3 at full resolution, and aggregates four 3×4 directional regions into categorical labels.

Parameters:

  • agent (Agent) – Agent to encode.

  • a_star_new (list[tuple[float, float]]) – Remaining A* path.

Returns:

Compact state tuple length 13.

Return type:

tuple[int, …]

reset(seed=None, options=None)[source]¶

Reset the environment and initialize per‑agent A* paths and states.

Randomizes start and goal positions subject to obstacle and separation constraints.

Parameters:

  • seed (int | None) – seed.

  • options (dict | None) – Unused, kept for API compatibility.

Returns:

Mapping from agent name to Q‑state, and mapping to raw observation.

Return type:

tuple[dict[str, tuple[int, …]], dict[str, np.ndarray]]

step(action)[source]¶

Advance the environment by one agent action.

Buffers the action, advances the world when the last agent has acted, updates rewards and terminations, and renders if enabled.

Parameters:

action (np.ndarray | int | None) – Action for the selected agent. None if terminated.

update_a_star_paths(agent)[source]¶

Advance and clean the remaining A* path for an agent.

Removes already reached waypoints based on proximity. Clears the remaining path upon entering a goal neighborhood.

Parameters:

agent (Agent) – Agent instance.

Returns:

True if the path list or status changed.

Return type:

bool

mas_navigation.custom_environment.raw_print_state(grid)[source]¶

Print a 2D integer grid to stdout.

Prints rows from top to bottom for quick inspection of the state before state aggregation.

Parameters:

grid (list[list[int]]) – 2D grid of cells. Each cell is an integer representing the state of that cell.
